p: Monoterpene hydrocarbons were the following main phytochemical group with eight (19.8 ± 0.1%) and nine (5.4 ± 0.7%) compounds identified in ginger and turmeric essential oils, respectively ( Table 1). Camphene (11.6 ± 0.3%), followed by limonene (3.2 ± 0.1%), α-pinene (2.7 ± 0.0%), and myrcene (1.3 ± 0.0%), was the main compound in ginger essential oil, while α-phellandrene (4.3 ± 0.4%) was the principal component in turmeric essential oil ( Table 1).
